p: During active COVID-19, the immunosuppressive therapy was discontinued in most rheumatology patients [ 29, 32– 35]. Another important topic is when to re-initiate these therapies. In the case reports Song et al. [ 35] and Mihai et al. [ 33], the immunosuppressive therapies were re-initiated 2–4 days after a negative test result for COVID-19. In their expert opinion article, Sarzi-Puttini et al. suggested that these drugs should be re-initiated only after two negative swabs [ 157].
